verses.verse: Then Deborah <S%H1683><s%> and Barak <S%H1301><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam <S%H42><s%> sang <S%H7891><s%> on that day, <S%H3117><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>
"Because the leaders took the lead <S%H6544><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> because the people <S%H5971><s%> offered <S%H5068><s%> themselves willingly, <S%H1288><s%> be blessed, Yahweh! <S%H3068><s%>

"Hear, <S%H8085><s%> you kings! <S%H4428><s%> Give ear, <S%H238><s%> you princes! <S%H7336><s%> I, <S%H7891><s%> even I, will sing to Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> I will sing <S%H2167><s%> praise to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

"Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> when you went forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Seir, <S%H8165><s%> when you marched out <S%H6805><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> of Edom, <S%H123><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> trembled, <S%H7493><s%> the sky <S%H8064><s%> also dropped. <S%H5197><s%> Yes, <S%H5645><s%> the clouds dropped <S%H5197><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%>

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> quaked <S%H5140><s%> at the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> even Sinai, <S%H5514><s%> at the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

"In the days <S%H3117><s%> of Shamgar <S%H8044><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Anath, <S%H6067><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Jael, <S%H3278><s%> the highways <S%H734><s%> were unoccupied. <S%H2308><s%> The travelers <S%H1980><s%> walked <S%H3212><s%> through byways. <S%H6128><s%>

The rulers <S%H6520><s%> ceased <S%H2308><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%> They ceased <S%H2308><s%> until I, <S%H1683><s%> Deborah, arose; <S%H6965><s%> Until I arose <S%H6965><s%> a mother <S%H517><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

They chose <S%H977><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> gods. <S%H430><s%> Then war <S%H3901><s%> was in the gates. <S%H8179><s%> Was there a shield <S%H4043><s%> or spear <S%H7420><s%> seen <S%H7200><s%> among forty <S%H705><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> in Israel? <S%H3478><s%>

My heart <S%H3820><s%> is toward the governors <S%H2710><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> who offered themselves willingly <S%H5068><s%> among the people. <S%H5971><s%> Bless <S%H1288><s%> Yahweh! <S%H3068><s%>

"Speak, <S%H7878><s%> you who ride <S%H7392><s%> on white <S%H6715><s%> donkeys, <S%H860><s%> you who sit <S%H3427><s%> on rich carpets, <S%H4055><s%> and you who walk <S%H1980><s%> by the way. <S%H1870><s%>

Far from the noise <S%H6963><s%> of archers, <S%H2686><s%> in the places of drawing water, <S%H4857><s%> there they will rehearse <S%H8567><s%> the righteous acts <S%H6666><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> the righteous acts <S%H6666><s%> of his rule <S%H6520><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%> "Then the people <S%H5971><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> went down <S%H3381><s%> to the gates. <S%H8179><s%>

<S%H5782><s%> 'Awake, awake, <S%H5782><s%> Deborah! <S%H1683><s%> Awake, <S%H5782><s%> awake, <S%H5782><s%> utter <S%H1696><s%> a song! <S%H7892><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> Barak, <S%H1301><s%> and lead away your <S%H7628><s%> captives, <S%H7617><s%> you son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam. <S%H42><s%>'
"Then a remnant <S%H8300><s%> of the nobles <S%H117><s%> and the people <S%H5971><s%> came down. <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh came down for me against <S%H7287><s%> the mighty. <S%H1368><s%>

Those whose root <S%H8328><s%> is in Amalek <S%H6002><s%> came out of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> after <S%H310><s%> you, <S%H1144><s%> Benjamin, among your peoples. <S%H5971><s%> Governors <S%H2710><s%> come down <S%H3381><s%> out of Machir. <S%H4353><s%> Those who handle <S%H4900><s%> the marshal <S%H5608><s%>'s staff <S%H7626><s%> came out of Zebulun. <S%H2074><s%>

The princes <S%H8269><s%> of Issachar <S%H3485><s%> were with Deborah. <S%H1683><s%> As was Issachar, <S%H3485><s%> so was Barak. <S%H1301><s%> They rushed <S%H7971><s%> into the valley <S%H6010><s%> at his feet. <S%H7272><s%> By the watercourses <S%H6390><s%> of Reuben, <S%H7205><s%> there were great <S%H1419><s%> resolves <S%H2711><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>

Why did you sit <S%H3427><s%> among <S%H996><s%> the sheepfolds, <S%H4942><s%> To hear <S%H8085><s%> the whistling <S%H8292><s%> for the flocks? <S%H5739><s%> At the watercourses <S%H6390><s%> of Reuben <S%H7205><s%> There were great <S%H1419><s%> searchings <S%H2714><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>

Gilead <S%H1568><s%> lived <S%H7931><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> the Jordan. <S%H3383><s%> Why did Dan <S%H1835><s%> remain <S%H1481><s%> in ships? <S%H591><s%> Asher <S%H836><s%> sat still <S%H3427><s%> at the haven <S%H2348><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and lived <S%H7931><s%> by his creeks. <S%H4664><s%>

Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> was a people <S%H5971><s%> that jeopardized <S%H2778><s%> their lives <S%H5315><s%> to the deaths; <S%H4191><s%> Naphtali <S%H5321><s%> also, <S%H4791><s%> on the high places of the field. <S%H7704><s%>

"The kings <S%H4428><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and fought, <S%H3898><s%> then the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> fought <S%H3898><s%> at Taanach <S%H8590><s%> by the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Megiddo. <S%H4023><s%> They took <S%H3947><s%> no plunder <S%H1215><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%>
From the sky <S%H8064><s%> the stars <S%H3556><s%> fought. <S%H3898><s%> From their courses, <S%H4546><s%> they fought <S%H3898><s%> against Sisera. <S%H5516><s%>

The river <S%H5158><s%> Kishon <S%H7028><s%> swept them away, <S%H1640><s%> that ancient <S%H6917><s%> river, <S%H5158><s%> the river <S%H5158><s%> Kishon. <S%H7028><s%> My soul, <S%H5315><s%> march on <S%H1869><s%> with strength. <S%H5797><s%>
Then the horse hoofs <S%H6119><s%> stamped <S%H1986><s%> because of the prancings, <S%H1726><s%> the prancings <S%H1726><s%> of their strong ones. <S%H47><s%>

<S%H779><s%> 'Curse Meroz, <S%H4789><s%>' said <S%H559><s%> the angel <S%H4397><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> <S%H779><s%> 'Curse bitterly <S%H779><s%> its inhabitants, <S%H3427><s%> because they didn't <S%H935><s%> come to help <S%H5833><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> to help <S%H5833><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> against the mighty. <S%H1368><s%>'

"Jael <S%H3278><s%> shall be blessed <S%H1288><s%> above women, <S%H802><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> of Heber <S%H2268><s%> the Kenite; <S%H7017><s%> blessed <S%H1288><s%> shall she be above women <S%H802><s%> in the tent. <S%H168><s%>
He asked <S%H7592><s%> for water. <S%H4325><s%> She gave <S%H5414><s%> him milk. <S%H2461><s%> She brought him <S%H7126><s%> butter <S%H2529><s%> in a lordly <S%H117><s%> dish. <S%H5602><s%>

She put <S%H7971><s%> her hand <S%H3027><s%> to the tent peg, <S%H3489><s%> and her right hand <S%H3225><s%> to the workmen <S%H6001><s%>'s hammer. <S%H1989><s%> With the hammer she struck <S%H1986><s%> Sisera. <S%H5516><s%> She struck through <S%H4277><s%> his head. <S%H7218><s%> Yes, <S%H4272><s%> she pierced and struck through <S%H2498><s%> his temples. <S%H7541><s%>

At her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> he fell, <S%H5307><s%> he lay. <S%H7901><s%> At her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> he fell. <S%H5307><s%> Where <S%H834><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> there he fell down <S%H5307><s%> dead. <S%H7703><s%>

"Through the window <S%H2474><s%> she looked <S%H8259><s%> out, <S%H2980><s%> and cried: Sisera <S%H5516><s%>'s mother <S%H517><s%> looked through the lattice. <S%H822><s%> <S%H7393><s%> 'Why is his chariot so long <S%H954><s%> in coming? <S%H935><s%> Why do the wheels <S%H6471><s%> of his chariots <S%H4818><s%> wait? <S%H309><s%>'
Her wise <S%H2450><s%> ladies <S%H8282><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> her, <S%H7725><s%> Yes, she returned answer to herself, <S%H561><s%>

<S%H4672><s%> 'Have they not found, have they not divided <S%H2505><s%> the spoil? <S%H7998><s%> A lady, <S%H7356><s%> two <S%H7361><s%> ladies to every <S%H7218><s%> man; <S%H1397><s%> to Sisera <S%H5516><s%> a spoil <S%H7998><s%> of dyed <S%H6648><s%> garments, <S%H7998><s%> a spoil of dyed <S%H6648><s%> garments embroidered, <S%H7553><s%> of dyed <S%H6648><s%> garments embroidered on both sides, <S%H7553><s%> on the necks <S%H6677><s%> of the spoil? <S%H7998><s%>'

"So let all your enemies <S%H341><s%> perish, <S%H6><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> but let those who love <S%H157><s%> him be as the sun <S%H8121><s%> when it rises forth <S%H3318><s%> in its strength. <S%H1369><s%>" Then the land <S%H776><s%> had rest <S%H8252><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>
